titleStmt.title: To the Mother of the Gods from Homeric Hymns
Machine readable text

bibl.author: Anonymous
bibl.title: The Homeric Hymns and Homerica with an English Translation by Hugh G. Evelyn-White. Homeric Hymns
bibl.publisher: Cambridge, MA.,Harvard University Press; London, William Heinemann Ltd.

change.item: Text keyboarded in the Philippines. Basic SGML tagging by Bill Merrill
Go over text, check cardbreaks, and change tags to be more TEI conformant.
split speeches and converted to unicode

body.p: I Prithee, clear-voiced Muse, daughter of mighty Zeus, sing of the mother of all gods and men. She is well-pleased with the sound of rattles and of timbrels, with the voice of flutes and the outcry of wolves and bright-eyed lions, with echoing hills and wooded coombes.
And so hail to you in my song and to all goddesses as well!
